ooC: Hopefully your posts will be an insiration to all, but more so 
to the=
 weaker posters of the RPG to improve they're posts, and 
possibly to spend=
 more time planning them out. =3D)

-- Pacifix / Crossroads --

The tone of=
 this bot's voice gave Pacifix a feeling that this bot 
wasn't hostile. He =
keeps the base's defense system online just in 
case, and he watches the ma=
ssive form cautiously as comes ever 
closer. Such an imposing beast was som=
ething to be reckoned with.

Hearing the bot, now revealed to have an Eleph=
ant beast mode, name 
himself an Autobot, he relaxes even more. Still a lit=
tle wary, he 
speaks to Hoist quietly, "Hoist, any confirmation on his clai=
m?"

Hoist's voice comes onto Pacifix' comm, "Yes, base camera has picked 
=
up an allied symbol on him. I'd be willing say with confidence he's 
not ho=
stile." 

"Thanks," replies Pacifix. He looks up at the bot again, and repl=
ies 
loudly, "Welcome Maximal Infantry Skullhammer to the Autobot base. 
Pl=
ease come down here and meet our crew. The base's defenses have 
been disar=
med." He puts his weapons away, and motions with his hand 
for the bot to j=
oin him. 

After waving, he opens a commlink to Crotale and 
Crossroads, "C=
rotale and Crossroads, I'm outside the base right now, 
come and meet a new=
comer to the planet, Skullhammer. He's an Autobot 
from Cybertron."

Then h=
e contacts JetV and Artemis, "Artemis and JetV, return to base 
as soon as =
possible, and be prepared to meet a visitor. Don't worry, 
he's not hostile=
."

--------------

Crossroads gets Pacifix' message, and quickly confirms =
that, "Gotcha 
Pacifix." He drags his small body out of a minor state of 
m=
editation, and walks out of his quarters. He turns down the hall, 
and begi=
ns to make his way to the exit of the base.

st time I joined a game, people

> (IC)
> Skullhammer's huge,=
 grey form thundered across the plains of the 
> African region. His large =
padded feet crashed along the ground at 
a 
> great pace, striking up a clo=
ud of dust which encircled and 
trailed 
> after him like a tsunami. Powerf=
ul robotic legs pushed him onwards 
> towards the base, his newly formed be=
ast mode speeding nearer and 
> nearer. 
> 
> His robotic mind, a network o=
f circuitry and uplink servo-chips, 
> accepted an incoming message clearly=
 across the rapidly lessening 
> distance between himself and the Autobot b=
ase. As he heard the 
voice 
> and verification of being an Autobot, his te=
nse steel muscles 
> relaxed, and he continued on his pace. Amongst the hea=
vy footfalls 
of 
> his massive elephant form, Skullhammer made his reply w=
ith a high 
> heart=85er, spark.
> 
> "Greetings Autobot Commander Pacifix.=
 This is Maximal Infantry 
> Skullhammer, approaching your base's eastern s=
ide. I've just 
landed 
> on this planet. Most of my own sensors are offlin=
e yet." His 
voice, 
> made up of a deep and even tonality in line with his=
 large body, 
was 
> clear even above the loud rumbling his four strong leg=
s made as he 
> rushed across the barren region.
> 
> Skullhammer's pace qu=
ickened, shocking even him. The corded steel 
> muscles of the Maximal warr=
ior flexed underneath the pseudo-skin 
> which covered him, propelling him =
along at speeds he didn't think 
> possible for the somewhat unwieldy and s=
izeable form which he 
> inhabited. His weighty body came closer and closer=
 to the base 
until 
> he was less than fifty meters. 
> 
> Well inside the=
 range of the base's autocannons, Skullhammer 
skidded 
> to a halt on a sm=
all stone ridge. The base was clearly an Autobot 
> site, and was furthermo=
re armed to the teeth, ready to unload a 
> powerful and violent volley of =
blasts upon his metallic hide. He 
> could almost picture the barrage of en=
ergy bolts and hot 
projectile 
> fire being fired in a terrifying storm of=
 death, and himself being 
> stuck right in the center of it, if he were to=
 make a wrong move 
or 
> come under suspicion. His life as an Autobot told=
 him the 
procedures 
> Autobots followed.
> 
> Speaking directly to the ba=
se now, closer in range, Skullhammer 
> raised his voice in a clear opening=
 statement. "Autobots, I am 
> Skullhammer, an Autobot of Cybertron sent to=
 assist the Maximals 
in 
> their mission here on Earth against the Predaco=
n forces."
